title: Pair for FF Strada
content:
I’m considering FF Strada for titles and subheads. Any suggestions for a body text?

[http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_strada\_text/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202192145/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_strada_text/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff\_strada\_text/")

 [‹ Help! Need the name of this Font!!!](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202192145/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41216 "Go to previous forum topic") [Handwriting font to go with Gotham Ultra for a logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202192145/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41176 "Go to next forum topic")
author: JB01

comments.content:
Actually, FF Strada works quite well for text. The round details disappear and it is quite sturdy.

Tell us more about your project. What is the content and audience?

Stephen,

Thanks for your help. The content of the document will focus on urban design issues, and will include a combination of text and drawings. The audience will be land developers; CEO and Board Members.

Thanks - J

You looking for a serif in particular? Ideas:

[Fresco](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202192145/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=fresco%20ot%20-sans)  
 [Freight Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202192145/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/garagefonts/freight_text/)  
 [Oranda](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202192145/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/bitstream/oranda_ot/)  
 [Charter](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202192145/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/paratype/itc_charter_ot/)
Btw is there any chance to have in a not-so-far future an Opentype release of Strada?
Thanks. I think it really deserves it!
